Title: Parallel construction
References: ŠTULAJTEROVÁ, A., JESENSKÁ, P.: English Stylistics. 1. vyd. Banská Bystrica : Univerzita Mateja Bela, 2013. 114 s.
Content:
Parallel construction (parallelism) is the use of components in a sentence that are grammatically the same, or similar in their construction, sound or meaning.

They are often backed up by repetition, which usually generates rhythm. This method adds balance to sentences giving ideas a smoother flow and thus can be persuasive because of the repetition it employs.

example:

  • Štefan ran into the room, into the garden and into our hearts.
  • Like father, like son.
  • Easy come, easy go.
